biography.value: These young bronze dragons perch upon the towers and parapets of the city and Castle Drakken. Once noble protectors of the city, they are now controlled by the will of the Haze.

description.value: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 ([[/damage 2d10 + 5 type=piercing]]) damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ([[/damage 2d6 + 5 type=slashing]]) damage.
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons: @UUID[Actor.YastyWB1IB8FMaJs.Item.1jJ0BbuFl65Ryvwu]{Lightning Breath} or @UUID[Actor.YastyWB1IB8FMaJs.Item.wNYwdt1NKOp1pp5F]{Repulsion Breath}

The dragon exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=15]] saving throw, taking 55 ([[/damage 10d10 type=lightning]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save ability=strength dc=15]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 40 feet away from the dragon.
The dragon can breathe air and water.
The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
While the dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate bronze statue.

The creature(s) that caused the dragon to animate becomes its quarry. The dragon knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long the quarry remains within Drakkenheim or until the dragon is destroyed.
The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The dragon's weapon attacks are magical.
If the tower dragon is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless a @spell[disintegrate] spell is cast on its remains.
